co.paralleluniverse.actors

Class ActorRefDelegateImpl<Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.actors.ActorRefDelegateImpl<Message>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActorRef<Message>, ActorRefDelegate<Message>, Port<Message>, SendPort<Message>, Serializable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SupervisorImpl

    public abstract class ActorRefDelegateImpl<Message>
extends Object
implements ActorRef<Message>, ActorRefDelegate<Message>, SendPort<Message>, Serializable

    An ActorRef which delegates all operations to another ActorRef.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • send

        public void send(Message message)
          throws SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef

        Sends a message to the actor, possibly blocking until there’s room available in the mailbox.

        If the channel is full, this method may block or silently drop the message. The behavior is determined by the mailbox’s OverflowPolicy, set at construction time. However, unlike regular channels, this method never throws QueueCapacityExceededException. If the mailbox overflows, and has been configured with the THROW policy, the exception will be thrown into the actor.

        Specified by:
        send in interface ActorRef<Message>
        Specified by:
        send in interface SendPort<Message>
        Throws:
        SuspendExecution

      • sendSync

        public void sendSync(Message message)
              throws SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef

        Sends a message to the actor, and attempts to schedule the actor’s strand for immediate execution. This method may be called when a response message is expected from this actor; in this case, this method might provide better latency than ActorRef.send(java.lang.Object).

        Specified by:
        sendSync in interface ActorRef<Message>
        Throws:
        SuspendExecution

      • send

        public boolean send(Message message,
                    long timeout,
                    TimeUnit unit)
             throws SuspendExecution,
                    InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef

        Sends a message to the channel, possibly blocking until there’s room available in the channel, but never longer than the specified timeout.

        If the channel is full, this method may block, throw an exception, silently drop the message, or displace an old message from the channel. The behavior is determined by the channel’s OverflowPolicy, set at construction time.

        Currently, this behavior is not yet supported. The message will be sent using ActorRef.send(Object) and the timeout argument will be disregarded

        Specified by:
        send in interface ActorRef<Message>
        Specified by:
        send in interface SendPort<Message>
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        timeout - the maximum duration this method is allowed to wait.
        unit - the timeout’s time unit
        Returns:
        true if the message has been sent successfully; false if the timeout has elapsed.
        Throws:
        SuspendExecution
        InterruptedException

      • send

        public boolean send(Message message,
                    Timeout timeout)
             throws SuspendExecution,
                    InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef

        Sends a message to the channel, possibly blocking until there’s room available in the channel, but never longer than the specified timeout.

        If the channel is full, this method may block, throw an exception, silently drop the message, or displace an old message from the channel. The behavior is determined by the channel’s OverflowPolicy, set at construction time.

        Currently, this behavior is not yet supported. The message will be sent using ActorRef.send(Object) and the timeout argument will be disregarded

        Specified by:
        send in interface ActorRef<Message>
        Specified by:
        send in interface SendPort<Message>
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        timeout - the method will not block for longer than the amount remaining in the Timeout
        Returns:
        true if the message has been sent successfully; false if the timeout has elapsed.
        Throws:
        SuspendExecution
        InterruptedException

      • trySend

        public boolean trySend(Message message)
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef

        Sends a message to the channel if the channel has room available. This method never blocks.

        Specified by:
        trySend in interface ActorRef<Message>
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • close

        public void close(Throwable t)
        Description copied from interface: SendPort

        Closes the channel so that no more messages could be sent to it, and signifies an exception occurred in the producer. The exception will be thrown when the consumer calls ReceivePort’s receive or tryReceive, wrapped by a ProducerException. Messages already sent to the channel prior to calling this method will still be received.

        Specified by:
        close in interface SendPort<Message>
